name: Acker Bilk
description:
'''Bernard Stanley''' "'''Acker'''" '''Bilk''' (28 January 1929 – 2 November 2014) was an English [[clarinetist]] and vocalist known for his breathy, vibrato-rich, lower-register style, and distinctive appearance – of [[goatee]], [[bowler hat]] and striped waistcoat.

Bilk's 1961 instrumental tune "[[Stranger on the Shore]]" became the UK's biggest selling single of 1962, spending 55 weeks on the charts and reaching No. 1 in the ''[[NME]]'' singles chart and No. 2 in the ''[[Record Retailer]]'' chart. It was the second No. 1 single in the United States by a British artist. In [[CHUM Chart|Canada]] it was number 4 for 4 weeks before peaking at number 3.
